meta.description: Learn the professional skill of writing NGO donation proposals, understanding their structure, purpose, and how to format them effectively using MS Word.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of an NGO Donation Proposal?
options: To request financial support or resources from donors for a specific cause
To invite people to a party
questions.explanation: A donation proposal is a written request asking potential donors for funds or resources to support a project.

questions.question: Which section of the proposal describes the specific issue the NGO intends to solve?
questions.explanation: The Problem Statement clearly defines the community need or issue that makes the project necessary.

questions.question: Which Microsoft Office application is most suitable for writing and formatting a detailed text-based grant proposal?
questions.explanation: MS Word is the standard word processing tool for creating professional multi-page documents like proposals.

questions.question: What should be included in the 'Budget' section of a proposal?
options: A detailed breakdown of estimated costs and how the funds will be used
questions.explanation: The Budget section provides transparency on financial requirements, showing donors exactly where their money will go.

questions.question: What is an 'Executive Summary' in a grant proposal?
options: A brief overview at the beginning that summarizes the entire proposal
questions.explanation: The Executive Summary gives busy donors a quick snapshot of the project's goals, methods, and needs.

questions.question: Why is it important to add a 'Cover Page' to your proposal?
options: It protects the paper from rain
It provides a professional first impression with the title, NGO name, and contact info
questions.explanation: A professional Cover Page establishes credibility and provides essential identification details immediately.

questions.question: Which feature in MS Word helps generate an automatic 'Table of Contents' for long proposals?
questions.explanation: Using Heading Styles allows Word to automatically recognize sections and build a navigable Table of Contents.

questions.question: In the context of a proposal, what does 'Impact' refer to?
options: The positive changes or benefits the project will bring to the community
questions.explanation: Donors want to know the 'Impact'â€”the tangible results and improvements their money will achieve.

questions.question: [Digital Skill] How can AI writing assistants help with grant proposals?
options: They can help draft persuasive text, check grammar, and improve clarity
They can open the bank account
They can drive to the donor's house
questions.explanation: AI tools can assist in overcoming writer's block, refining tone to be more persuasive, and proofreading.

questions.question: Which formatting tool allows you to present the budget numbers in a neat, aligned grid?
questions.explanation: Tables are the standard way to present numerical data like budgets clearly and professionally.

questions.question: What is a 'Grant'?
options: A loan you must pay back
A sum of money given by an organization/government for a specific purpose, usually not repaid
questions.explanation: Unlike a loan, a grant is a financial award given to an entity to facilitate a goal or project.

questions.question: Why should you research the donor before sending a proposal?
options: To ensure your project aligns with their funding goals and values
questions.explanation: Targeting the right donor ensures that your proposal is relevant to their interests, increasing the chance of success.

questions.question: Which element adds credibility to your proposal?
options: Testimonials, data/statistics, and past success stories
questions.explanation: Evidence of past success and data-driven arguments build trust with the potential donor.

questions.question: To ensure the proposal looks consistent, you should use:
options: Consistent fonts, headings, and margins throughout the document
questions.explanation: Consistency in formatting makes the document look professional and easier to read.

questions.question: What is the 'Timeline' section of a proposal?
options: A schedule showing when project activities will happen
questions.explanation: The Timeline outlines the project schedule, showing donors that the plan is realistic and time-bound.

questions.question: If you want to save the proposal so it can't be easily edited by others, which format should you use?
questions.explanation: PDFs preserve formatting and prevent accidental changes, making them the standard for sharing final documents.

questions.question: Which tool in Word helps check for spelling errors before printing?
questions.explanation: Always run a Spell Check to ensure the document is error-free and professional.

questions.question: The 'Conclusion' of a proposal should:
options: Summarize the main points and reiterate the request for support
questions.explanation: The conclusion wraps up the argument and leaves a final strong impression on the donor.

questions.question: What is the purpose of adding 'Headers and Footers'?
options: To repeat information (like page numbers or NGO name) on every page automatically
questions.explanation: Headers and Footers add professional polish and help navigation (page numbers).

questions.question: When emailing a proposal, what should be in the subject line?
options: Clear and professional title (e.g., 'Grant Proposal: Clean Water Project - [NGO Name]')
questions.explanation: A clear subject line ensures the email is opened and routed to the correct person.
